title: Reset and Rebirth
outcome: Three days after mass Council resignations, the BCI automatically triggers a 'reset protocol,' erasing all individual compliance scores and special privileges. Social order fractures but also democratizes, as residents rebuild society outside digital rankings. The city's cohesion is tested and reinvented, while a posthumous message from Halden reframes his death as a deliberate act to force this reset. The long-term future becomes uncertain, but powered by hope instead of surveillance.

events.description: Three days after the last mass Council resignations, residents awaken to find all BCI compliance scores wiped—regardless of status. No one is flagged, privileged, or restricted.

Citizens scramble to navigate life without digital rankings. Access to jobs, housing, and services becomes chaotic, with mistrust and opportunity rising in equal measure as residents negotiate new norms.
Technicians uncover a posthumous message: Halden designed the reset to trigger if Council authority broke down, believing the city should decide its own rules without algorithmic oversight.
Neighborhood meetings and public assemblies emerge; residents debate and draft new principles for fairness and accountability in city life without the BCI as a controlling force.
